UX Design

Virtual Travel Livestreaming Visible Radio

“NOMAD”

Redefining Traveling as a Virtual Experience for the Youth Suffering from Covid-Blue Depression

Individual Project (Oct 2021 - )
Tools: Figma, ProtoPie
Link: Prototyping

Problem

A heightened desire to go outside or to see even more of the world and feeling a connection with people during the Pandemic.

Solution

Travel and Connect Virtually through Livestreaming Videos [or Visible Radios], Easily Taken by Your Neighbours across the World

#Information and Communication Technology (ICT) #Social Psychology #Covid-Blue

Context

After the Pandemic hit...

“ I have been virtually traveling with Tinder passport. ”

“ I use Snapchat Maps for my travel ”

95% looked for travel inspiration and 53% heightened their desire to explore even more of the world.

* source: virtual travel Youtube viewer’s comments & Booking.com

“ Youth depression doubled during the pandemic ”

“ Young adults hardest hit by loneliness during pandemic ”

* source: CNN and Harvard Research

The lonely and depressed Youth were using applications that allowed them searching locations and exploring regions through in-app “map.”
Generative Research

Initial Survey

69 survey participants

survey link

Although many people enjoy watching travel videos from youTube or snapchat and instagram videos and share travel videos to close people, their fear for invasion of privacy (64%) and difficulty of publicly creating travel content (67%) is deterring them from sharing content publicly. meanwhile, most of them were willing to introduce their cities and countries to others.

Competitive Analysis

Based on the initial survey, I’ve selected five video platforms related to online travel or could be used for such purposes.

Semi-Structured Interviews

Based on competitive analysis, I had interviews with five people who use the competitors’ products.

Key Similarities...

During Coronavirus lockdown, they have been missing travelling because of the feeling of connectedness with people as well as the desire for new sightseeing besides their rooms.

Key Frustrations...

Unpredictable Video Content (e.g., encountering selfies or workout videos) randomly popping out when watching videos from the existing social media apps.

Fear for Invasion of Privacy and Unwanted Communication with “strangers” when using social media.

Predictability

Predictability of a function in UX is all about knowing in advance or feeling the upcoming event. Encountering unexpected and unenjoyable content can make the experience stressful and burdensome.

Privacy UX

When it comes to social media products, uploading personal content often results in the users being exposed to unwanted attention and contact unless the product company carefully deals with it.
Synthesis
Jasmine

20 yr-old freshman living in Toronto who is outgoing, vehement, inquisitive, friendly and frequently uses Snapchat, Instagram, Tinder

Jasmine graduated high school during the pandemic and is spending her freshman year without meeting any new friends. She could not plan to travel abroad with her new colleague friends, and she was pretty depressed for months. The pattern of escaping to social media to get out of the emotions nevertheless gets more depressed when she turns off her phone.

"I don't want to feel isolated anymore."

excerpted from Interviewee E

Huan

24 yr-old graphic designer living in Singapore who is exploratory, imaginative, reserved, private and frequently uses Pinterest, YouTube, Drive and Listen

Huan loves to travel — at least until he encountered the turbulent Covid-19 era. He loves traveling while working. He also has a photograph Instagram account with 3k followers, where he posts photos taken while traveling. However, it is not an available option for now. He has been searching for ways to feel refreshed but hasn't found any.

"I am usually reserved, but these days I yearn for refreshment.”

excerpted from Interviewee D

Jasmine’s Daily Life. . .
Huan’s Daily Life. . .

HOW MIGHT WE

Cure lonelineness and depression -- feeling of disconnectedness

and

Fulfill the heightened desire to go outside - “travel”?
Design
Creativity vs. Feasibility Graph
Affinity Mapping

Although many of us cannot travel far from our hometown,
we can secondhand experience people’s daily lives through visible radio
where the creator show around their neighbors and freely talk to/with listeners.

User Needs

Boredom from the lockdown

Unpredictability of video content before clicking

Fear to invasion of privacy

Psychological Burden to create video content publicly

Receival of unwanted direct messages (DMs)

Design Implications

Apply Gamification for amusement

Apply predictable design system by sorting based on landscape

social media with minimizing personal info requirement (like Twitter!)

livestreaming like videochatting with the acquaintence but without face reveal

Link to Other social media for deeper connection
UX Design

Low-Fi Wireframes

UserFlow
GUI Design
High-Fi GUI
